p: Hospital-acquired infections are directly linked to Gram-positive pathogens as Staphylococcus aureus, and Gram-negative pathogens as Escherichia coli and Pseudomonas aeruginosa. It is estimated that in the United States in the 1990s hospital infections cost $4.5 billion and contributed to more than 88,000 deaths [ 1]. The main treatment adopted to combat hospital infections is the indiscriminate use of antimicrobials that generated methicillin-resistant S. aureus. Frequent use of antibiotics is cited as the cause of various bacteria resistance to a range of commonly available antibiotics, especially penicillin [ 2].
